record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, JUNE 11, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 2 p.m., Monday, June 11; that on Monday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day, and there then be a period of morning business until 3:30 p.m., with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees; that at 3:30 p.m., the Senate resume debate on the motion to proceed to H.R. 6, with the time until 4:30 equally divided and controlled between the chair and ranking member of the Energy Committee; that from 4:30 to 5:30 p.m., the Senate resume debate on the motion to proceed to S.J. Res. 14,

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
